Description.Text: This is a fantastic property located in one of the best London locations. Perfect for visiting the many museums in the area, or some of the most famous shopping streets of London, High Street Kensington and Knightsbridge. A very modern property, full of designer touches that blend perfectly with the period building and features. (06/08 RPL)

This boutique hotel is located in the heart of the Royal Borough of Kensington, in the centre of London, and within 2 minutes walking distance from Gloucester Road underground station. Some of London's main museums like the Natural History, Science and the Victoria and Albert Museums can be reached on foot in a few minutes, as well as Hyde Park and the shopping haven of fashionable High Street Kensington.

The rooms are of medium sized and decorated following contemporary designs. An almost all-white scheme has been used for walls and fabrics, creating an interesting contrast with the dark wooden furniture. These DELUXE rooms are larger in size and many benefit from private balcony or decked terrace. All rooms have air-conditioning and flat screen televisions and most have an small seating area. Both, bathrooms and bedrooms are in very good condition, having been recently refurbished to high standards.

This is a very imposing, traditional London Georgian Townhouse, typical of this upmarket location. The white facade, black wrought iron railings and the columns that flank the entrance makes this a very interesting building.

The property does not have a restaurant as such, but there is a bar in the entrance that serves very light snacks and drinks. There are plenty of restaurants of all types in the area, from traditional pubs to some of the most renown restaurants in London.
The lobby is very small, almost non existent, typical of these boutique hotels. There is a bar lounge to the right of the entrance and a staircase that leads directly to the guest rooms.
